Introduction
Introduction
Established in 2011, ISMT is on a mission to contributing in Nepal's higher education by providing internationally recognized and industry relevant qualifications. In academic partnership with the University of Sunderland, UK, and Pearson Edexcel, UK, ISMT is redefining higher education with a bold vision—bridging the gap between academia and industry. ISMT's commitment to academic excellence is reflected in its inclusive and cost-effective educational approach, delivering international standards adopting core local values.
The institution fosters a holistic learning environment that encourages active student engagement through project-based work, interactive discussions, presentations, and diverse assessment methodologies. Beyond academics, ISMT offers diverse range of extracurricular activities, including sports clubs, workshops, Bootcamps, and special interest groups, promoting the development of technical expertise alongside essential interpersonal, managerial, and leadership skills.
At ISMT, students have the unique opportunity to earn prestigious UK qualifications without leaving Nepal, thereby gaining a competitive edge in the global job market. ISMT's dedication to providing a supportive and inclusive learning environment ensures that graduates are well-prepared to make meaningful contributions to their communities, nation, and the world at large.

Why Study BTEC  BSc.IT, and BHM at ISMT College?
The changing world of the 21st century has a dire need for industry-relevant education. The education that prepares students to take initiation and demonstrate responsibilities in identifying, analyzing, and solving problems and can work in teams and make decisions in complex and unpredictable contexts and, most importantly, prepare them to be lifelong learners.
Today the employers can choose employees from across the world, it is clear that the future competitiveness of students depends on the quality of education they receive.
Considering these realities, ISMT offers internationally recognized degrees (BSc. (Hons) Computer Systems Engineering, BBA and BHM in collaboration with Pearson BTEC and The University of Sunderland, UK. The same courses (Pearson BTEC) are taught in Colleges and Universities in the UK and in other 173 countries. It is proven that these qualifications raise the knowledge, skills, and attitudes of its graduates so that they stand at the front line in the competitive market. This qualification is equivalent to the second year of a three-year university degree course.
Thus, students who have achieved an HND can complete their Bachelor’s degree by enrolling directly to the third in a University. Actually, students have plenty of options ahead of them. They can complete their bachelor's degree at ISMT Nepal or can have their credit transferred to one of thousand Universities in Australia, USA, UK, Canada New Zealand or many more.
Further, there are several visible reasons to study at ISMT college;
ISMT has a "Placement and Internship Cell " to help its students and graduates for placement and internships. They also arrange a range of activities and events that help students develop their industry relevant personal and professional skill set. For example, we sent HM Graduates to China, Malaysia and Dubai to gain industry experience in relevant Hospitality Business.  We arrange or facilitate internship opportunities to interested Computing and IT graduates or students to relevant IT companies.
The college has in its resource pool of (overseas) lecturers, entrepreneurs, professionals and visiting professors who bring with them a wealth of experience backed up with academic excellence.
The college provides all the resources such as libraries, E-library, computer labs and sports facilities.
The faculty members are also selected from highly qualified subject experts, gifted lecturers with an invaluable fusion of teaching practice and current professional experience in relevant subject areas.
By default, we are conscious of the demands and the challenges that the global market is placing on graduates, and we are committed to responding to these challenges by delivering cost-effective, relevant, and internationally recognized academic programs. Certainly, receiving qualification from ISMT offers fantastic opportunities in the growing and exciting corporate world.

Master of Business Administration [MBA]
An MBA (Master of Business Administration) is a post graduate level degree program designed to prepare students for leadership roles in the business world. The program typically covers a wide range of business topics, including finance, marketing, operations, management, and strategy.
MBA programs can be found at many universities and business schools around the world, and they come in a variety of formats, such as full-time, part-time, and online. Full-time MBA programs typically take two years to complete and require students to attend classes on a regular basis, while part-time and online programs offer more flexibility in terms of scheduling.
The curriculum of MBA programs typically includes core courses that provide a broad understanding of business concepts and practices, as well as elective courses that allow students to specialize in a particular area of interest. FAQs - IT Courses in Nepal 2024
How long is the IT course in Nepal? Most undergraduate IT courses in Nepal, such as BSc IT typically last 3 to 4 years , computer engineering may take up to 5 years , while diploma programs can range from 1 to 3 years .
What is the 3-year IT degree in Nepal? A common 3-year IT degree in Nepal is the BSc (Hons) Computing offered by various colleges, focusing on software development and IT fundamentals.
Who is eligible for IT in Nepal? Eligibility for IT courses in Nepal usually requires a 12th-grade education (or equivalent) with a background in science, or other, depending on the program and institution. Computer engineering courses require you to pass +2 in science and crack competitive exams, while some degrees accept other fields like management and humanities as well.
Can I study IT without maths in Nepal? While many IT programs recommend a background in mathematics, some diploma and bachelor courses may accept students without a strong math background. However, having math skills can be beneficial in the long run.
What is the scope of IT in Nepal? The scope of IT in Nepal is growing rapidly, with increasing demand for IT professionals in software development, cybersecurity, and data analysis, making it a promising field for future careers.
Is a diploma in IT available in Nepal? Yes, various colleges and technical institutes in Nepal offer diploma programs in IT, such as a Diploma in Information Technology and a Diploma in Cyber Security .
How long is BSc CSIT in Nepal? The BSc in Computer Science and Information Technology (BSc CSIT) in Nepal typically lasts 4 years .

What Is BBA?
BBA (Bachelor of Business Administration) is a management degree designed to build your foundation in business strategy, leadership, marketing, finance, and administration. In Nepal, it is one of the most popular degrees among +2 graduates, especially those from management or science backgrounds.
The program is offered by Tribhuvan University, Pokhara University, Kathmandu University, Purbanchal University, and international colleges affiliated with foreign universities.
A BBA graduate is typically trained to work in banks, startups, NGOs, IT companies, or even government service. Many also choose the BBA route as a stepping stone to an MBA or specialized business or marketing career.
What Is BHM?
BHM (Bachelor of Hotel Management) is also an undergraduate degree focused on hospitality and tourism services. It combines classroom learning with practical training in hotel operations, guest relations, food and beverage management, front office management, and event handling.
In Nepal, BHM is offered by colleges under Tribhuvan University, Pokhara University, Purbanchal University, and many international affiliations from varied countries.
Students pursuing this course gain practical experience through training in college-operated model hotels and kitchens, as well as collaborations with hospitality businesses in Nepal and internationally.
BHM graduates typically work in hotels, airlines, cruise lines, event companies, or tourism firms. The course is ideal for students who enjoy service, travel, and working with people.
Similarities of BHM and BBA
Both BHM and BBA are management courses. The end goal of learning any of these degrees is to operate and grow a business. This brings an overlapping list of skills, which must be taught to both BHM as well as BBA students.
Management: Both need to plan, organize, and lead teams/operations.
Finance: Both require understanding budgets and financial health.
Marketing: Both need to attract customers (guests or buyers).
HR: Both manage people effectively.
Customer Focus: Both aim for satisfaction, be it guest or client.
Operations: Both ensure smooth day-to-day processes.
Ultimately, both BHM and BBA are about making a business succeed financially and operationally. A hotel (BHM focus) is still a business that needs profit, efficient processes, and happy customers, just like any other company (BBA focus). But the difference lies in their approach, specialisation, classroom environments, and industry connections.
So,
Which is the better option, a BHM or a BBA?
A BBA degree is a more favourable option for those interested in administrative or banking roles and are planning to pursue an MBA in future. It also builds a solid foundation for marketing and human resource management.
BHM is great if you enjoy serving people, cooking or housekeeping. You can pursue a specialised MBA even after BHM.
